answers.answer: I can't fully relate bc I'm only 11wks but try not to worry too much. it's a mother's natural instinct to worry about the well being of her childz I worry every time I get an ultrasound or something feels weird. but you will be fine, I will be praying for you and the baby as well as the doctors that will care for you both that they make all the right decisions. your going to be fine!
Why are you getting induces at 34 weeks?
Why are you being induced?? I'm sure baby will be fine, may need extra monitoring. But if doctor didn't think baby would be healthy enough, I doubt they would induce.
My water broke at 30 weeks. Ive been in the hospital for about 4 weeks. I'm trying to stay positive but the closer it gets the more I worry.
My brother was born at 32 weeks, and aside from growing up to be an attorney, seems to be totally fine!  We'll keep you in our prayers!

I delivered my first at 31 weeks due to preeclampsia. Having a baby early is very scary but preemies do very well especially at 34 weeks. Advocate for what you believe in and you may be surprised at how strong you are. I can relate to not feeling heard, it's a hard time to go through. In a few months all of this will be far behind you so just stay strong to what you believe in and focus on the health and love between you and your baby.

Did they give your baby steroids to develope the lungs faster?,i had premie twins at 29 wks and thanks to those shots they had no issues breathing thank God all the did was spend some time in the hospital to gain weight...congrats and good luck

Its a safety thing for you and baby. I have not had this happen to me but a friend of mine did. When your water brwaks early it can cause infections for both of you if not taken care of carefully.  As whybthey might have you in a hospital on bed rest versus being at home on bed rest. Just take it easy ask how baby is doing and how high of a heart rate the baby has every day. As long as it stays high don't worry your doing wonderful for your baby. Its safe after 34 weeks to have baby. Baby may have to stay longer in hospital for monitoring but its for babys safety. If ever you have questions ask them there is no stupid question  when it comes to pregnancy worries. Good luck and rest up.

I had two steroid shots and antibiotics just in case I develop an infection.  So far hes healthy. It just hit mr today that there's a chance he may not be as healthy as im hoping. Im already so emotional being away from my kids for so long and now my mind is thinking this. I pray for him every night I just cant wait till hes in the clear and all this is just a memory.
I will be praying for you and your baby i am sure if you already spend 4 weeks at the hospital and they decided to induced you it is because they has done everything for your baby to be healthy

My daughter was born at 27 weeks.  Today, she is almost 8 and you would have no idea.  My sister's two were born at 34 and 35 weeks.  The baby may need a few extra days of monitoring, but I am sure everything will be fine. Try to relax and get ready for baby.

I'm sure everything will be fine you will be in my prayers I know it can be really scary.. idk why they are inducing you.. because my water broke at 26 weeks and they out me on nectar at the hospital and they said they would keep me till full term.. baby didn't want to wait and came at 30 on her own.  But they did mention that they were hoping I would at least make it to 34 weeks.. good luck stay strong it will be tough but stay positive. I'm here if you need to talk..

question: Im getting induced Monday and im only 34 weeks. Its just now hitting me that he may not be healthy. I can't stop crying im so scared.  I feel like no one understands or everyone is to busy to hear me out.
title: so worried
